17.9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION. Any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach, termination or validity thereof shall be settled in accordance with one of the following procedures. Contractor and NICE shall use the procedures in the following order of priority.

                                       43

          17.9.1. In the event of any dispute, controversy or claim of any kind or nature arising under or in connection with this Agreement (including but not limited to disputes as to the creation, validity, interpretation, breach or termination of this Agreement) (a "DISPUTE"), then upon the written notice of either Party, the Dispute will be submitted to the project manager on behalf of each party to be escalated, in case the parties are unable to resolve such Dispute, to the parties C.E.O.'s

          17.9.2. Any dispute that the parties are unable to resolve pursuant to Section 17.9.1. within 30 Days, will be submitted exclusively to the competent courts in the Tel-Aviv-Jaffa District in Israel.

          17.9.3. Without derogating from rights of termination as detailed in this Agreement, it is clarified that Contractor will continue to provide the Manufacturing Outsourcing Services and NICE shall continue to perform its obligations hereunder during any litigation, mediation or legal proceedings commenced pursuant to this Section 17.9. above and the existence of a Dispute shall not enable Contractor to stop work or services or otherwise not timely perform its obligations or enable NICE to stop payments or otherwise not timely perform its obligations.

          17.9.4. The foregoing shall not affect the right of the parties to seek injunctions before the competent Court.

17.9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION. Any dispute arising out of or relating to this Agreement or the breach, termination or validity thereof shall be settled in accordance with one of the following procedures. Contractor and NICE shall use the procedures in the following order of priority.

                                       43

          17.9.1. In the event of any dispute, controversy or claim of any kind or nature arising under or in connection with this Agreement (including but not limited to disputes as to the creation, validity, interpretation, breach or termination of this Agreement) (a "DISPUTE"), then upon the written notice of either Party, the Dispute will be submitted to the project manager on behalf of each party to be escalated, in case the parties are unable to resolve such Dispute, to the parties C.E.O.'s. It is clarified that Contractor will continue to provide the Manufacturing Outsourcing Services and NICE shall continue to perform its obligations hereunder during any litigation, mediation or legal proceedings. Parties can mutually agree on any resolution method, even if not specified in this agreement, to solve the dispute in an efficient and reasonable manner.

          17.9.2. Any dispute that the parties are unable to resolve pursuant to Section 17.9.1. within 30 Days, will be submitted exclusively to the competent courts in the Tel-Aviv-Jaffa District in Israel.

          17.9.3. Without derogating from rights of termination as detailed in this Agreement, the existence of a Dispute shall not enable Contractor to stop work or services or otherwise not timely perform its obligations or enable NICE to stop payments or otherwise not timely perform its obligations.

          17.9.4. The foregoing shall not affect the right of the parties to seek injunctions before the competent Court.
perturbation.explanation: The inclusion of "Parties can mutually agree on any resolution method, even if not specified in this agreement, to solve the dispute in an efficient and reasonable manner" undermines the dispute resolution process by suggesting methods not originally agreed upon. This contradicts the established process, creating uncertainty and potentially rendering the original agreement unenforceable.

perturbation.original_text: 17.11. LAW AND JURISDICTION. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of Israel, without giving effect to choice of law rules.
perturbation.changed_text: 17.11. LAW AND JURISDICTION. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the state of Israel, without giving effect to choice of law rules. However, if the dispute arises outside of Israel, the laws of that jurisdiction apply.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence "However, if the dispute arises outside of Israel, the laws of that jurisdiction apply" creates a contradiction. The original clause establishes Israeli law as governing, while the addition introduces potential application of foreign laws, leading to ambiguity and uncertainty about which laws apply.
